skillTree.localised_description: "Ride with me? In broad daylight? Dear, you are far too unimportant for that."

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

skillTree.localised_description: Discreetly poisoning the enemy commanders the night before battle is... well, just another continuation of diplomacy, like war itself.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: Another secret recipe of Lucrezzia's, this concoction will greatly improve the imbiber's strength and resilience. Maybe, just maybe, also poison them. A bit.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

ui_effects.localised_text: Will execute the recipient below a 10% hit points threshold.

skillTree.localised_description: The Lady of Pavona is famous, among other things, for kissing the weapon of today's champion before his duel or battle. Of course, her lipstick is terribly poisonous.

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

skillTree.localised_description: The Goddess of Battle protects Her own.
Tileans are an odd bunch, known to fight to the last for the most disparate reasons: their ideals, their captain, their regiment, their purse, a painting.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for Broken Lances, Noble Retinue and Knights Encarmine (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Pikemen and Half-Pikes (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +5% for all crossbow units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: +5% for Pikemen, Half-Pikes, Broken Lances, Noble Retinue, Knights Encarmine and all crossbow units
	(Lord's army)
effects.icon: BUGGED FOR XP UNIT SETS, HAPPENS BY DEFAULT, INTENDED

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The previous seven husbands of Lucrezzia's have always been useful and influential men, until they stopped being such. During these dire circumstances of exile, the new consort must be especially... supportive.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +10 with all Southern Realms

skillTree.localised_description: Tibaldus Marsarius de Vela, current Prince of Tobaro and powerful banker. His city is a safe port and cosmopolitan center that is certainly very promising in the right hands. However, Magritta's rulers would feel threatened.

effects.description:
Leadership: +5 when fighting against Skaven
	(all armies)

skillTree.localised_description: Marrying the eccentric ruler of Magritta would make for an interesting life and a hand on the wheel of the powerful city, but it would also antagonize Lucrezzia's Tilean compatriots.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: -30 with East Ind Company

Recruitment cost: -10% for Infantry units
	(all armies)

Leadership: +5 when fighting at sea
	(all armies)

Melee attack: +5 when fighting at sea
	(all armies)

skillTree.localised_description: Lucrezzia may consolidate her relationship with Xavier Rothemuur, current ruler of the northern port and expatriate member of House Rothemuur of Marienburg. Lucrezzia would secure the support of not one, but two wealthy City-States, but the other rulers of Estalia may definitely perceive her as a threat.

effects.description: Allegiance points gained: +10% for alliances with the Empire

Leadership: +10 when fighting against Vampire Coast
	(all armies)

skillTree.localised_description: ...Or maybe not. Having a lot of suitors, especially the influential ones, may open a lot more doors than only one.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +15 with Empire, Kislev, Cathay and Bretonnia

skillTree.localised_description: Oh, so much can be done with a letter here, a smile there, or more audacious initiatives. The Lady of Pavona's ability to maintain her web of connections is powerful and precious in this world.

effects.description: Diplomatic relations: +10 with Empire, Kislev, Cathay and Bretonnia
Diplomatic relations: +20 with Empire, Kislev, Cathay and Bretonnia
Diplomatic relations: +30 with Empire, Kislev, Cathay and Bretonnia

skillTree.localised_description: Lucrezzia's manipulation over military champions and leaders leads to survival of the fittest.

effects.description:
Leadership: +4 for Lords and embedded Heroes
	(all armies)

Melee attack: +4 for Lords and embedded Heroes
	(all armies)

Melee defence: +4 for Lords and embedded Heroes
	(all armies)

skillTree.localised_description: Mercenary hosts usually include powerful regiments with double pay and double the risks, once dubbed in Tilea "Duplicarii". The original meaning has gone lost, and the usual sense is now "You bunch of dog-botherers will better get it done, with what you cost me."

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

attributes.bullet_text: This unit does not suffer any form of leadership loss and will never rout.
This unit's vigour is less affected by fatiguing actions, such as combat.

skillTree.localised_description: Costly gear lent to the mercenary companies may be expensive, but it may save the day and the treasury afterwards.
A false promise here, a shift of alliances there, and the enemy has no idea it's not an ally anymore.

related_attributes.bullet_text: This unit can deploy outside the deployment zone.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Spirit Leech"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Spirit Leech Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Spirit Leech Upgraded"
Overcast spell: "Aspect of the Dread Knight Upgraded"

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

effects.description: Cooldown: -30% to "Aspect of the Dread Knight"
Overcast spell: "Aspect of the Dread Knight Upgraded"

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

effects.description: Cooldown: -50% to "Aspect of the Dread Knight"
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Aspect of the Dread Knight"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Aspect of the Dread Knight Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Aspect of the Dread Knight Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "Soulblight Upgraded"
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for "Doom & Darkness"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "Doom & Darkness Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "Doom & Darkness Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

ui_effects.localised_text: Strong vs 25 men unit or above

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Fate of Bjuna"
Overcast spell: "The Purple Sun of Xereus Upgraded"

target_if: Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Cooldown: -30% to "The Purple Sun of Xereus"
Overcast spell: "The Purple Sun of Xereus Upgraded"

target_if: Not on or below a platform

effects.description: Cooldown: -50% to "The Purple Sun of Xereus"
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for "The Purple Sun of Xereus"
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for "The Purple Sun of Xereus Upgraded"
Miscast base chance: -15% for "The Purple Sun of Xereus Upgraded"

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Well, this is straightforward enough.

effects.description:
Melee defence: +2 for spear, pike, halberd, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +2 for hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for spear, pike, halberd, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Oh wait, there's another chapter.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +2 for spear, pike, halberd, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +2 for hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for spear, pike, halberd, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +4 for hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Even the lousiest commander knows that you need two halves of a pair of scissors.

effects.description:
Leadership: +2 for hand weapon, pike and halberd units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +3 for spear, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +4 for hand weapon, pike and halberd units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +6 for spear, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +6 for hand weapon, pike and halberd units
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +10 for spear, lance and great weapon units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Duck! Shoot! Duck! Shoot! Shoot- shoot, that was wrong.

effects.description:
Missile resistance: +3% for all melee units
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: +6% for all melee units
	(Lord's army)

Missile resistance: +10% for all melee units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The key is not letting your initiative depend on a lucky die.
It's seldom enough to have only some of your troops to be ready to take a beating. The enemy has their own plans.

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +3% for spear, pike, halberd and lance units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +3 for great weapon, hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +6% for spear, pike, halberd and lance units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +6 for great weapon, hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +10% for spear, pike, halberd and lance units
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +10 for great weapon, hand weapon and dual wield units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "You kill them before they kill you, sonnie. That's all it is."

effects.description:
Melee attack: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Though of course, if they do stab you, you better know how to parry."

effects.description:
Melee defence: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Plus, you better kill them dead with the one shot you have."

effects.description:
Weapon strength: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

Reload time reduction: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "And to do that, it helps if you put all your weight where it counts."

effects.description:
Charge bonus: +2% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "Look, at the end of the day, you may be alive and you better learn from what didn't kill you."

effects.description:
Physical resistance: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +1% per experience rank for all units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Being known for actually paying one's hirelings - those that come back alive, anyway - pays off.
Personally seizing the means of production never felt better.
Improving infrastructure and rebuilding the war-ravaged regions is key to a prosperous economy.

effects.description:
Construction cost: -4% for all buildings
	(local province)

Construction cost: -7% for all buildings
	(local province)

Construction cost: -10% for all buildings
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Money must flow.
"I have seen better lavatory walls than this - I'll have it down by the morrow, that's a pledge!"

effects.description:
Attrition: +5% when under siege
	(enemy armies in local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +8% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition: +5% when under siege
	(enemy armies in local region)

Attrition suffered by defender: +15% when laying siege or encircling
	(local region)

Attrition: +5% when under siege
	(enemy armies in local region)

skillTree.localised_description: A commander that allows his captains and troops to everything they can put their hands on is either irresponsible, well-adviced, criminally aggressive or all of the above.
"People say that the colour of magic is purple, white, red... I say it is gold. For all that lot."

effects.description:
Unlocks Hero recruitment: Battle Wizard
	(local province)

Hero recruitment cost: +5% for Wizards
	(local province)

Unlocks Hero recruitment: Battle Wizard
	(local province)

Hero recruitment cost: +10% for Wizards
	(all provinces)

skillTree.localised_description: This man can easily distinguish between an ancient elven magical sword of implacable might and a piece of shiny iron, which is not so simple when the artifact itself is in that disguise.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

skillTree.localised_description: Sometimes it is just time to party. The louder, the better.
This commander has accrued a retinue of the sliest and shrewdest captains and guides available. Their advice is worth every silver coin.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: War is merely the extension of economy by other means. But you do need someone to do the actual killing.

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +2 for Mercenary Captains
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
Being supportive of the flourishing tilean art is prestigious, and prestige is lucrative.
Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
"You know you're doing it right when everyone and their mamas are sending people to stab you."

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors
Hero self-defence: +10% chance of wounding aggressors

skillTree.localised_description: Knowledge that the enemy wallet might buy your troops out even before the first battle puts huge pressure to make sure it doesn't happen.
Commerce is the life-blood of any economy, and the sea must be its heart.

"Open the coffers, put up more signs. I want more cannons, pikes, even ogres, even those buggers with the paper wings. Everyone. I shall have that castle by tomorrow or by Myrmidia I will drown them in mercs."
Kill not, waste not.
Such is the pinnacle of the tilean merchant prince and politician that seemingly anything can be handled.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

target_if: Unit is not Lord or Hero

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

factionEffects.localised_description: The forced exile from the razed homecity of Pavona determines that Lucrezzia's qualities and abilities must ensure new possibilities.

effects.description:
All units (Rank 7 and above):
	Attribute: Strong Vigour
	Armour: +5 
	all Damage: +8%%
Foster Independence commandment: additional +4 Diplomatic relations with Men and High Elves
Hero recruit rank: +3 for Mercenary Captains

items.colour_text: Lucrezzia always wears, somewhere on her person, a dagger coated with another of her brews. Can't blame someone for being prepared for a midnight stab.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +20% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit can cause terror, making its melee target rout for a short time. Units that cause terror are immune to terror and fear themselves.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Lucrezzia always wears, somewhere on her person, a dagger coated with another of her brews. Can't blame someone for being prepared for a midnight stab.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +20% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Every rose has its thorn. This one in particular, a handy dagger and several hired guardians as well.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +5 for embedded Heroes
	(Lord's army)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: A commoner was once asked by a foreign recruiter about a band of Estalian mercenaries. Shrugging, he replied that they were "evil men", which was misunderstood as being 'local' for tough troops. Like many mistranslations, it stuck.

effects.description:
All damage: +10% for Adventurers, Royal Guard, Riders and Lancers (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Speed: +10% for Adventurers, Royal Guard, Riders and Lancers (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: +10% for Adventurers, Royal Guard, Riders and Lancers
	(Lord's army)
